intro: Agalinis chaparensis, commonly known as Chapare false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to Bolivia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Agalinis chaparensis is adapted to arid conditions and has a short growing season.
